work.name: School of Medicine, University of Pittsburgh
highlights: Implement multi-source models based on research papers’ pseudocode and two Java libraries (Weka & Smile) to diagnose influenza and increase 2% accuracy comparing to existing single source model prediction.
Supervised 2 undergrads summer interships, providing coding guidance in Python for research projects.
Led a Medical Image Processing project, managing over 100GB of data for preprocessing, and utilizing a pre-trained large model (Prov-GigaPath) to extract features for cancer diagnosis.

Deployed a Llama3-8B model locally on a 25GB GPU, ensuring data privacy and security for sensitive medical research.

publications.name: Online Transfer Learning for RSV Case Detection
publications.summary: Multi-Source Adaptive Weighting (MSAW) is an online transfer learning method that dynamically adjusts weights for historical and new data, improving performance in sequential classification tasks, particularly in healthcare applications.

publications.name: Transfer Learning with Clinical Concept Embeddings from Large Language Models
publications.summary: This study shows domain-specific language models like Med-BERT improve knowledge transfer across healthcare sites, outperforming generic models, but excessive tuning of biomedical embeddings can reduce effectiveness. Balance is crucial.

projects.name: Probabilistic Disease Surveillance Using Large Language Model
projects.summary: This study aims to examine the capability of LLMs to provide probability estimations. We compared different prompting strategies and evaluated an open-source LLM model, LLaMA 3, for detecting infectious disease cases from emergency department encounters.

projects.name: Exploring the Integration Potential of Foundational Models (Prov-GigaPath) with the National Mesothelioma Virtual Bank
projects.summary:
This study aims to drive insights by combining Prov-GigaPath's computational capabilities with Mesothelimoa data Center.
Potential replication of the model for other biorepositories or research focuses

projects.name: Bayesian Network Transfer Learning
projects.summary: This project created the Bayesian Network Transfer Learning (BN-TL) algorithm to re-use of source model, such as influenza, learned from electronic medical record (EMR) data to predict the target data set.
